item.description:
• VegWorcester free video screening of Latest In Clinical Nutrition Volume 5. (You may remember Dr Greger's work from watching his speaking gig at the first Worcester VegFest in 2010) Check it out & Bring your friends!
  • http://www.drgreger.org/
  • http://www.vegworcester.co​m/
  • Michael Greger, M.D., is a physician, author, and internationally recognized speaker on a number of important public health issues. Currently Dr. Greger proudly serves as the Director of Public Health and Animal Agriculture at the Humane Society of the United States.


Here's the list of chapters:

    Antioxidant content of 3,139 foods
    Plant foods versus animal foods
    What's your healthy eating score?
    Did a vegan diet kill this baby?
    American vegans placing babies at risk
    Vegan epidemic
    Pregnant vegans at risk for iodine deficiency
    Too much iodine can be as bad as too little
    Calcium absorption: soy milk versus cow milk
    The effect of soy on premature puberty
    Is milk and mucus a myth?
    Cholesterol bomb shell
    Industry left with egg on its face
    Egg industry blind spot
    Golden glow
    Produce, not pills to increase physical attractiveness
    Rosy glow
    Chicken consumption and the feminization of male genitalia
    Food sources of PCB chemical pollutants
    Cancer prevention and treatment may be the same thing
    Vegetables versus breast cancer
    Mushroom size matters
    Multivitamin use and breast cancer risk
    Relieving yourself of excess estrogen
    Stool size matters
    Food mass transit
    Bowels of the Earth
    Improving mood through diet
    Inflammatory remarks about arachidonic acid
    Chicken, eggs, and inflammation
    Chicken’s fate is sealed
    Fish oil in troubled waters
    The effect of canned tuna on future wages
    Pork tapeworms on the brain
    Avoiding epilepsy through diet
    Saffron for the treatment of Alzheimer’s
    Saffron versus Aricept
    Do doctors make the grade?
    Avocado chemo
    Unholy guacamole?
    Resuscitating Medicare
    Our number one killer can be stopped
    China Study on sudden cardiac death
    The Tomato Effect

 

There is also a Facebook Event for this: http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=218210134881344

  • For more info:
  • manda@vegworcester.com
  • http://www.vegworcester.com    
  • http://www.facebook.com/vegworcester
item.how_to_find_us: Park on the street, come and knock on the door.
item.name: Video Screening: Dr Greger's 2011 nutrition DVD
